column1: If the direction valves should be controlled via the servo drive, the following three modes are available. In addition, the respective digital outputs on the servo drive must be assigned to the correct function. For the direction valves, HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG(77) must be selected. Optionally, two further valves can be controlled depending on the hydraulic setpoint table (HYD_VAL_OPT1(74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2(75)).

column3: 0101 Volumetric flow rate control (without pressure limited)
NewSetPoint (ramp change with rising edge or new hydraulic control mode)

column1: Table 7.61: Hydraulic control word: What the bits mean

column3: SetPointAcknowledge (Set if there is a rising edge at NewSetPoint and the setpoint is adopted; cleared if newSetPoint = 0)
CylValvePos; Valve switch positive cylinder direction
CylValveNeg; Valve switch negative cylinder direction

column1: Table 7.63: Hydraulic status word: What the bits mean, expand the table

The motion block table contains 16 motion blocks which can be parametrized (Index 0 to 15). The control mode, reference values and ramps as well as the valve positions and switching conditions can be specified in each motion block.

If the servo drive is to be used as a stand-alone device, it is possible to set up a type of sequence control using the motion block table. To activate the transition of the motion block via the motion block table, the operating mode Tab(2) must be selected in the motion profile P 2862[0] - HYD_OpMode. This allows switching between the motion blocks to be controlled by either timing or an event. This function is enabled in the Tab(2) operation mode.

As an option, it is also possible to use operation mode CTRL2 to switch the motion blocks via a higher-order control system. These can be configured in advance for different control tasks so that during the process only setpoints and the respective table index must be selected or specified by the control system.

column6: Hydraulic: Status of the control functions
Hydraulic: Acceleration of the pump speed
Hydraulic: Deceleration of the pump speed

column1: Selecting the hydraulic control mode (Para 2860 HYD_TabConMode):
- VolConPlim(1) = volumetric flow rate control (pressure limited)
- VolCon(5) = volumetric flow rate control (without pressure control)

Setpoint for pressure, volumetric flow rate, cylinder speed, cylinder position. The unit (HYD_UNIT) depends on the control mode and corresponds to bar for pressure control, l/min for volumetric flow rate control and rpm for pump speed control. For cylinder position and speed control, the unit corresponds to the UserUnit selected in the scaling (chapter 8.2). This also applies for derivative 1 and 2 or speed and acceleration.

column5: Hydraulic: Setpoint for volumetric flow rate/pressure/speed/position
Hydraulic: Setpoint for volumetric flow rate/pressure/speed/position

column1: Setpoint acceleration (this parameter is not active for pressure and volumetric flow rate)

For the control of the valve position, switching of the position controller settings and of the pump data set as well as for enabling the active decompression, the respective bits can be enabled in this parameter for every motion block. The active decompression prevents that a motion block is started as long as pressure is still applied. If the bit is active, the pressure is reduced via a defined ramp (P 2850.11 decmpRate) below a specified pressure level (P 2850.10 decmpLvl) before the respective motion block is started.
Bit Designation Meaning Control mode Pressure limit Volumetric flow rate limit

column4: Selection for second position-controller setting P 2871 HYD_PosConAdv2
Selection for second pump data set P 2873 HYD_Pump2
Active decompression for the respective motion block
Selection for second pressure-controller setting P 2874 HYD_PressCon2

column1: Using the scaling parameter Hyd_Limit (P 2872) allows the respective currently active limit to be scaled for each motion block. This makes it possible to limit each individual process. ",What are the three modes available for controlling direction valves via the servo drive according to the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"The three modes are HYD_CYL_POS (76), HYD_CYL_NEG (77), and optionally HYD_VAL_OPT1 (74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2 (75) depending on the hydraulic setpoint table.","For direction valves control via servo drive, the modes include HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG (77), with additional options HYD_VAL_OPT1 (74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2 (75) based on the hydraulic setpoint table.","HYD_CYL_POS (76), HYD_CYL_NEG (77), and optionally HYD_VAL_OPT1 (74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2 (75) are the modes for controlling direction valves via the servo drive.","The document specifies HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG (77) as primary modes, with HYD_VAL_OPT1 (74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2 (75) as optional for direction valves control via servo drive.","Controlling direction valves via the servo drive involves modes HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG (77), plus optional HYD_VAL_OPT1 (74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2 (75) from the hydraulic setpoint table."

If the direction valves should be controlled via the servo drive, the following three modes are available. In addition, the respective digital outputs on the servo drive must be assigned to the correct function. For the direction valves, HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG(77) must be selected. Optionally, two further valves can be controlled depending on the hydraulic setpoint table (HYD_VAL_OPT1(74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2(75)).

If the servo drive is to be used as a stand-alone device, it is possible to set up a type of sequence control using the motion block table. To activate the transition of the motion block via the motion block table, the operating mode Tab(2) must be selected in the motion profile P 2862[0] - HYD_OpMode. This allows switching between the motion blocks to be controlled by either timing or an event. This function is enabled in the Tab(2) operation mode.

As an option, it is also possible to use operation mode CTRL2 to switch the motion blocks via a higher-order control system. These can be configured in advance for different control tasks so that during the process only setpoints and the respective table index must be selected or specified by the control system.

",What does the parameter P 2879 HYD_AddProcData in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document describe?,"P 2879 HYD_AddProcData describes various scales and additional parameters for press controllers, pumps, and position controllers with PDO access.","It includes details on additional KpScale and KiScale for press controllers, displacement scales for pumps, and scales for position controllers, all accessible via PDO.","The parameter outlines additional processing data like KpScale and KiScale for press controllers, displacement scales for pumps, and position controller scales.","HYD_AddProcData (P 2879) provides scales for press controllers' Kp and Ki, pumps' displacement, and position controllers, with PDO access.","This parameter details scales for enhancing press and position controllers' performance and adjusting pumps' displacement, accessible through PDO."

If the direction valves should be controlled via the servo drive, the following three modes are available. In addition, the respective digital outputs on the servo drive must be assigned to the correct function. For the direction valves, HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG(77) must be selected. Optionally, two further valves can be controlled depending on the hydraulic setpoint table (HYD_VAL_OPT1(74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2(75)).

",What are the bits and their meanings in the Hydraulic control word as per Table 7.61 in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"Bits 0-3 define operation modes like pressure control and cylinder speed control, while bits 4-15 cover new setpoint, pressure limitations, and unused bits.","The hydraulic control word uses bits 0-3 for control modes, bit 4 for new setpoint, bits 5-7 for specific functions, and bits 11-15 for pressure limitation statuses.","Bits 0 to 3 specify hydraulic control modes, bit 4 indicates a new setpoint, and bits 11 to 15 show pressure limitation inactivity across different quadrants.","Table 7.61 explains that bits 0-3 are for operation modes, bit 4 for ramp change or new mode, and bits 11-15 for pressure limitation inactive statuses.","The control word's bits 0-3 are dedicated to operation modes, bit 4 to setpoint changes, and bits 11-15 to indicate inactive pressure limitations in various quadrants."

In addition, the respective digital outputs on the servo drive must be assigned to the correct function. For the direction valves, HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG(77) must be selected. Optionally, two further valves can be controlled depending on the hydraulic setpoint table (HYD_VAL_OPT1(74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2(75)).

",How is the hydraulic status word defined in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"The hydraulic status word includes bits indicating control mode, setpoint acknowledgment, leakage bypass activity, cylinder area, and valve switch positions.","It comprises bits for hydraulic control mode, setpoint acknowledgment, switch leakage bypass, cylinder area, control limit, ramp target, valve positions, and setpoint window reached.","Bits in the status word signify various states like control mode, setpoint acknowledgment, cylinder area, and whether the setpoint window is reached.","The status word uses bits to represent hydraulic control mode, setpoint changes acknowledgment, cylinder area switchover, and valve positions among others.","Defined by bits, the status word covers hydraulic control mode, setpoint acknowledgment, cylinder area, valve positions, and setpoint window status."

",What parameters are associated with hydraulic pump speed ramps in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"Parameters include HYD_PumpAcc (2855) for acceleration and HYD_PumpDec (2856) for deceleration, both in rpm/s.","HYD_PumpAcc (2855) and HYD_PumpDec (2856) define the acceleration and deceleration rates of the pump speed, respectively.","The document specifies HYD_PumpAcc (2855) for pump speed acceleration and HYD_PumpDec (2856) for deceleration, measured in rpm/s.","Acceleration and deceleration of pump speed are controlled by HYD_PumpAcc (2855) and HYD_PumpDec (2856), with units in rpm/s.","Pump speed ramps are managed by HYD_PumpAcc (2855) for acceleration and HYD_PumpDec (2856) for deceleration, both parameters in rpm/s."

If the direction valves should be controlled via the servo drive, the following three modes are available. In addition, the respective digital outputs on the servo drive must be assigned to the correct function. For the direction valves, HYD_CYL_POS (76) and HYD_CYL_NEG(77) must be selected. Optionally, two further valves can be controlled depending on the hydraulic setpoint table (HYD_VAL_OPT1(74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2(75)).

column1: Table 7.63: Hydraulic status word: What the bits mean, expand the table

The motion block table contains 16 motion blocks which can be parametrized (Index 0 to 15). The control mode, reference values and ramps as well as the valve positions and switching conditions can be specified in each motion block.

If the servo drive is to be used as a stand-alone device, it is possible to set up a type of sequence control using the motion block table. To activate the transition of the motion block via the motion block table, the operating mode Tab(2) must be selected in the motion profile P 2862[0] - HYD_OpMode. This allows switching between the motion blocks to be controlled by either timing or an event. This function is enabled in the Tab(2) operation mode.

As an option, it is also possible to use operation mode CTRL2 to switch the motion blocks via a higher-order control system. These can be configured in advance for different control tasks so that during the process only setpoints and the respective table index must be selected or specified by the control system.

column6: Hydraulic: Status of the control functions
Hydraulic: Acceleration of the pump speed
Hydraulic: Deceleration of the pump speed

column1: Selecting the hydraulic control mode (Para 2860 HYD_TabConMode):
- VolConPlim(1) = volumetric flow rate control (pressure limited)
- VolCon(5) = volumetric flow rate control (without pressure control)

Setpoint for pressure, volumetric flow rate, cylinder speed, cylinder position. The unit (HYD_UNIT) depends on the control mode and corresponds to bar for pressure control, l/min for volumetric flow rate control and rpm for pump speed control. For cylinder position and speed control, the unit corresponds to the UserUnit selected in the scaling (chapter 8.2). This also applies for derivative 1 and 2 or speed and acceleration.

column5: Hydraulic: Setpoint for volumetric flow rate/pressure/speed/position
Hydraulic: Setpoint for volumetric flow rate/pressure/speed/position

column1: Setpoint acceleration (this parameter is not active for pressure and volumetric flow rate)

For the control of the valve position, switching of the position controller settings and of the pump data set as well as for enabling the active decompression, the respective bits can be enabled in this parameter for every motion block. The active decompression prevents that a motion block is started as long as pressure is still applied. If the bit is active, the pressure is reduced via a defined ramp (P 2850.11 decmpRate) below a specified pressure level (P 2850.10 decmpLvl) before the respective motion block is started.
Bit Designation Meaning Control mode Pressure limit Volumetric flow rate limit

column4: Selection for second position-controller setting P 2871 HYD_PosConAdv2
Selection for second pump data set P 2873 HYD_Pump2
Active decompression for the respective motion block
Selection for second pressure-controller setting P 2874 HYD_PressCon2

column1: Using the scaling parameter Hyd_Limit (P 2872) allows the respective currently active limit to be scaled for each motion block. This makes it possible to limit each individual process. ",What are the hydraulic control modes listed in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"Modes include PressCon(0) for pressure control, VolConPlim(1) for volumetric flow rate control (pressure limited), SpeedCon(2) for speed control, PosCon(3) for position control, NPumpCon(4) for pump speed control, and VolCon(5) for volumetric flow rate control without pressure control.","The document lists PressCon(0), VolConPlim(1), SpeedCon(2), PosCon(3), NPumpCon(4), and VolCon(5) as available hydraulic control modes.","Available modes are pressure control (PressCon(0)), volumetric flow rate control with pressure limit (VolConPlim(1)), speed control (SpeedCon(2)), position control (PosCon(3)), pump speed control (NPumpCon(4)), and volumetric flow rate control without pressure control (VolCon(5)).","Hydraulic control modes encompass PressCon(0), VolConPlim(1), SpeedCon(2), PosCon(3), NPumpCon(4), and VolCon(5), covering various control needs.","The document specifies six control modes: PressCon(0), VolConPlim(1), SpeedCon(2), PosCon(3), NPumpCon(4), and VolCon(5), each for different hydraulic control scenarios."

Optionally, two further valves can be controlled depending on the hydraulic setpoint table (HYD_VAL_OPT1(74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2(75)).

",What is the significance of the 'Hydraulic Setpoint' parameter in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"The Hydraulic Setpoint parameter defines the target values for pressure, volumetric flow rate, cylinder speed, or position, depending on the control mode.","It specifies setpoints for various control modes, with units varying by mode (e.g., bar for pressure, l/min for volumetric flow rate).","This parameter sets reference values for hydraulic control modes, adapting units based on the mode (pressure, flow rate, speed, or position).","HYD_Ref (2857) determines setpoints for hydraulic operations, with units like bar, l/min, or rpm, depending on the selected control mode.","The setpoint parameter adjusts according to the control mode, providing targets for pressure, flow rate, speed, or position in respective units."

Optionally, two further valves can be controlled depending on the hydraulic setpoint table (HYD_VAL_OPT1(74) and HYD_VAL_OPT2(75)).

",What does the '1st Reference Value Derivative' parameter indicate in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"It represents the rise time or speed of the setpoint, indicating how quickly the setpoint value changes.","This parameter shows the rate at which the setpoint value increases or decreases, affecting the system's response time.","The 1st derivative of the reference value determines the speed of setpoint changes, influencing the system's dynamic behavior.","HYD_dRef (2858) controls the speed of setpoint adjustments, crucial for managing system transitions smoothly.","It defines the velocity of setpoint changes, ensuring controlled and predictable system responses to new setpoints."

",What is the role of the 'Hydraulic Control Parameters Table' in the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document?,"It enables configuration of valve positions, controller settings, and pump data sets, including active decompression for motion blocks.","This table allows setting bits for valve control, position controller adjustments, pump data selection, and decompression activation per motion block.","Parameters in this table manage valve switching, controller settings, and decompression, ensuring safe and efficient motion block execution.","It provides control over valve positions, pump data, and decompression via bit settings, tailored for each motion block's requirements.","The table facilitates precise control over motion blocks through valve, controller, and pump settings, including decompression for safety."
